content.description: This is the line of bolts about 10-15Ft right of "Chicken Heads". More slabby than Chicken Heads (i.e. fewer/smaller "heads"). Climb the line to the Chicken Heads anchor.  5.7
content.protection: Crux may be the first few moves, so maybe a stick-clip for the 1st bolt???

climbs.name: Found-A-Line
climbs.fa: Jonathan Garlough, Jim Dickson, Josh Corbett

content.description: This is the left most route on the slab. Start up the slab on the edge of the tree line. Pull onto a small ledge at 1/3 height. Continue straight up a groove/scoop and pull over the bulge to a large flake and easier terrain. Move right to the anchors on Elvis Is In The House.

On the left side of the slab look for the bolt line just left of a small overlap/eyebrow of rock. Climb the steep rock past the first 3 bolts (crux) and then continue past 5 more bolts to a bolt anchor.

On the right side of the slab look for a line of bolts hidden in the moss. Follow the line of bolts up the moss covered slab on chickenheads! Finish at a bolt anchor.   (Note- as of 2014 the moss was pretty much brushed off, and a whole new route to the right ("Unknown") had been put in! )

climbs.name: Brilliant
climbs.fa: Joe & Judy Perez, Al Hospers, Brad White

content.description: Climb the slab up featured scoops and knobs! Follow the bolts past a very small right facing corner. Continue up the slab past bolts to another mini crux 3/4 of the way up. At the last bolt break left to the anchors on Slabba Do Ya.

A fun and well protected slab route. Climb up the center of the slab past 7 bolts to the trees above. A second bolt was added next to the last bolt to make an anchor to lower off with one rope. I recommend stopping here. The climbing above is very dirty.
content.protection: 7 bolts to bolt anchor or continue to trees above

content.description: The Little Slab is located between the Lumberjack wall the Main Cliff. The slab is about 120' tall, but most routes stop at about 80' to avoid the dirty top. The slab offers a handful of enjoyable friction climbs on quality featured rock.
